metadata.Description: The process of reducing or eliminating carbon dioxide emissions from various sectors to mitigate climate change.

entities.Description: The process of reducing or eliminating carbon dioxide emissions from various sectors to mitigate climate change.
Markets where electricity, natural gas, and other energy commodities are bought and sold.
Agencies that promote and support the development and use of renewable energy sources.
Technologies that have been used for energy generation and distribution for a long time.
The Paris Agreement Goals are the targets and commitments made by countries to combat climate change and reduce greenhouse gas emissions.
The Paris Agreement Goals are the targets and commitments made by countries to combat climate change and reduce greenhouse gas emissions.
The use of less energy to provide the same level of output or service, resulting in reduced energy consumption, cost savings, and environmental benefits.
Cooperatives that enable individuals or communities to collectively own and manage energy resources.
The process of capturing and storing energy for later use.
A policy instrument that puts a price on carbon emissions, either through a carbon tax or a cap-and-trade system, to incentivize the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions.

relations.Description: Decarbonization addresses carbon emissions by implementing strategies and technologies that reduce the reliance on fossil fuels and promote renewable energy sources.
relations.Subject: decarbonization

relations.Description: Decarbonization employs clean energy technologies such as solar power, wind power, and hydropower to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and transition to a low-carbon economy.
relations.Subject: decarbonization

relations.Description: Decarbonization collaborates with energy companies to develop and implement sustainable energy solutions that contribute to the reduction of carbon emissions.
relations.Subject: decarbonization

relations.Description: Decarbonization supports energy efficiency programs that aim to reduce energy consumption and promote the use of energy-saving technologies in various sectors.
relations.Subject: decarbonization

relations.Description: Decarbonization administers carbon pricing mechanisms to incentivize the reduction of carbon emissions and encourage the adoption of cleaner energy alternatives.
relations.Subject: decarbonization

relations.Description: Decarbonization measures carbon footprint to assess the environmental impact of activities and identify areas for improvement in terms of carbon emissions reduction.
relations.Subject: decarbonization

relations.Description: Decarbonization aligns with the goals and objectives of the Paris Agreement, aiming to limit global warming to well below 2 degrees Celsius and pursue efforts to limit the temperature increase to 1.5 degrees Celsius.
relations.Subject: decarbonization

relations.Description: Decarbonization is an instance of sustainable development, as it promotes the transition to a low-carbon economy while considering social, economic, and environmental aspects.
relations.Subject: decarbonization
traditional energy technologies
relations.Description: Traditional energy technologies implement the Energy Efficiency Policy to promote the use of energy-saving designs and materials.

relations.Subject: traditional energy technologies
relations.Description: Traditional energy technologies provide funding for research in renewable energy sources.

relations.Subject: energy cooperatives
relations.Description: Energy cooperatives address energy poverty by providing affordable and sustainable energy solutions to underserved communities.

relations.Subject: energy cooperatives
relations.Description: Energy cooperatives collaborate with local governments to implement renewable energy projects and promote sustainable energy practices.

relations.Subject: energy efficiency
relations.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.

relations.Subject: energy efficiency
relations.Description: Energy efficiency employs energy audits to identify energy-saving opportunities and optimize energy use.

relations.Subject: carbon pricing
relations.Description: Carbon pricing implements energy efficiency policies that incentivize the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions.

relations.Subject: carbon pricing
relations.Description: Carbon pricing plays a role in climate change mitigation efforts by incentivizing the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions.

relations.Subject: energy efficiency
relations.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.

relations.Subject: renewable energy agencies
relations.Description: Renewable energy agencies employ experts in the field of renewable energy to drive innovation and promote the adoption of clean energy technologies.

relations.Subject: clean cooking
relations.Description: Clean cooking implements energy efficiency policies that promote the use of clean and efficient cooking technologies.

relations.Subject: energy poverty indices
relations.Description: Energy poverty indices implement energy access programs to provide affordable and reliable energy services to underserved communities.

Renewable energy is a key sub-element of decarbonization. It involves the generation of energy from renewable sources such as solar, wind, hydro, and geothermal, which do not produce greenhouse gas emissions.
relations.Subject: renewable energy

relations.Description: Energy efficiency is an important sub-element of decarbonization. It focuses on reducing energy consumption and improving energy productivity to minimize greenhouse gas emissions.
relations.Subject: energy efficiency

relations.Description: Carbon capture and storage is a significant sub-element of decarbonization. It involves capturing carbon dioxide emissions from industrial processes and storing them underground to prevent their release into the atmosphere.
relations.Subject: carbon capture and storage

relations.Description: Electrification is a crucial sub-element of decarbonization. It involves the transition from fossil fuel-based energy sources to electricity for various applications such as transportation, heating, and cooking, reducing reliance on carbon-intensive fuels.
relations.Subject: electrification

relations.Description: Sustainable transportation is a key sub-element of decarbonization. It focuses on promoting low-carbon modes of transportation such as electric vehicles, public transit, cycling, and walking to reduce greenhouse gas emissions from the transportation sector.
relations.Subject: sustainable transportation
